author: Special Correspondent
text:
Election officials at a meeting on the model code of conduct in Karaikal on Wednesday.

All licensed firearm holders should deposit their weapons with the nearest police stations in view of the elections, said T. Karikalan, District Collector.

Addressing officials for making election-related arrangements here on Wednesday, Mr. Karikalan said the pistol owners and other arms should deposit the weapons and obtain receipt from the nearest police station. He said that static surveillance teams, flying squads, surveillance teams, and video viewing teams have been constituted for checking violations. Seven check-posts have been set up at the entry points to Karaikal district.

Earlier, at a special meeting on “Systematic Voters Education and Electoral Participation” (SVEEP), the Collector discussed the measures for ensuring cent per cent voting. The fresh voters should be sensitised to exercise their franchise without fail. He said that awareness campaign would be conducted across the district in this regard.
title: Firearm holders asked to deposit weapons with police
